entities.name: MICROSOFT
entities.description: Microsoft is a leading global software and device maker, subject to scrutiny under U.S. and foreign competition laws. It produces highly sophisticated software products and services, such as Windows, Xbox, and Surface devices. Microsoft also acquires device and datacenter components from sole suppliers and faces legal, regulatory, and litigation risks.

entities.name: EUROPEAN COMMISSION
entities.description: The European Commission closely scrutinizes the design of high-volume Microsoft products and the terms on which Microsoft makes certain technologies available to other companies. It has enforced competition laws against Microsoft, including ordering the creation of new versions of Windows and addressing concerns related to web browsing software.

relationships.relationship_description: The European Commission scrutinizes Microsoft's product designs and technology terms, enforcing competition laws and ordering changes to Microsoft products.
